2020 ESC Guidelines on sports cardiology and exercise in patients with cardiovascular disease: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32860412/ The proinflammatory effects of chronic excessive exercise: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30884427/ Source of the U-shaped curve: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4451435/ Personalised exercise dose: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29301027/ The effects of endurance exercise on the heart: panacea or poison?: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32152528/ Exercise and the heart--the harm of too little and too much: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25757005/ Training for Longevity: The Reverse J-Curve for Exercise: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32848273/ (suggests a slightly lower upper limit for benefit)

media:group.media:title: The CULT of Superstar Doctors
media:group.media:description:
The best deal in streaming (seriously): 1 year of CuriosityStream + Nebula for only $14.76 by visiting https://curiositystream.com/medlife and using the code 'medlife'. Sign up today and enjoy thousands of titles on both sites, it's the best way to support this channel. Thank you!
We have a problematic tendency to elevate scientists or doctors to rockstar status, which can lead to fraud, betrayal, malpractice and death. Explore three stories from the exciting but controversial field of regenerative medicine.
Sign up for my free newsletter: https://medlife.substack.com/
The Ballad of Superstar Surgeon Paolo Macchiarini by @Henrik Widegren (go check out his songs!)

entry.title: The Human Body is a Joke – Science Stand Up Comedy | Dr Rohin Francis

media:group.media:title: The Human Body is a Joke – Science Stand Up Comedy | Dr Rohin Francis
media:group.media:description:
Yet more human body fails. This time it’s parts of the body that seem actively intent on just being total d*cks.
This set was recorded at a ‘best of’ live gig hosted by Festival of the Spoken Nerd at London’s Bloomsbury Theatre. It was my first live gig for two and a half years or so (can’t think why), and I’m sure it shows but it was great fun. Especially at such a cool venue!
Find their new series of “A Podcast Of Unnecessary Detail” wherever you get your podcasts, or at @Unnecessary Detail. I'm in episode 1, which is out TODAY! But don’t let that put you off.
Podcast link: https://festivalofthespokennerd.com/podcast/
Their constituent parts are:
@Helen Arney @Steve Mould @Stand-up Maths

entry.title: When Social Media Doctors Get Mixed Up With NFTs

media:group.media:title: When Social Media Doctors Get Mixed Up With NFTs
media:group.media:description:
The perils of being a medical influencer... I'm not saying this is an NFT scam. But the pre-test probability is high. With the added bonus of being an antivax fundraiser...oh dear.
I can't actually recall how I found this, I just stumbled on it on twitter and had no idea what I was watching. The videos at the time had about 100 views each, the first one has now ticked past 180k views. One MIGHT suggest that I had secretly invested in these NFTs and I've just given them free publicity...muahaha. Well not really, as they're not on sale yet. Plus I'm not that smart anyway.
Sign up for my free newsletter: https://medlife.substack.com/
I hope it's evident that I am not seeking drama and am working on the assumption that most/all of these medfluencers didn't get the full story, but I'd probably recommend others give NFTs a wide berth. Wanting to raise money for charity is a noble goal, but there are ways to do it without all this scammy overlay. NFT minting is ultimately a way of raising money from gullible people who receive very little in exchange. If the goal is delivering healthcare to remote areas, again the web3 angle seems unnecessary.
https://twitter.com/MedCrisis/status/1514373761469980677 https://www.metadocsnft.com/
Million rupee studio a reference to @Coffeezilla Dan Olson a reference to his phenomenal video about NFTs @Folding Ideas https://youtu.be/YQ_xWvX1n9g
-----------------

entry.title: How To Do CPR In Space

media:group.media:title: How To Do CPR In Space
media:group.media:description:
It's a common everyday scenario. Cardiac arrest in space. Make sure you're prepared – you could save a life.
If you want to access Nebula for only $14.79 for A WHOLE YEAR you also get year's subscription to CuriosityStream thrown in for free! https://curiositystream.com/medlife. It's the best way to support me to keep making videos.

entry.title: Doing Real Science (and Breakdancing) In Zero Gravity

media:group.media:title: Doing Real Science (and Breakdancing) In Zero Gravity
media:group.media:description:
Support the channel by visiting https://www.curiositystream.com/medlife and use the code 'medlife' for a year of CuriosityStream and Nebula – where you'll find 14 and a half extra minutes of footage at the end of this video!
I got to do some real science in weightlessness! A total of 23 whole astro minutes in freefall. This wasn't a tourist flight but a real life science campaign with the European Space Agency and NASA. It really was a dream come true. I've wanted to do a parabolic flight ever since I watched 'The Making of Apollo 13' (the movie not the actual event) as a kid and learnt how they filmed it. I guess this will be the closest I'll get to going into space!
Huge thank you to Neil Melville, Ruth McAvinia, Anne-Clotilde Duchesne, Sébastien Turay, Karina Marshall-Goebel, Rosita Suenson, Lars, and all the scientists I met and chatted to on the campaign.
As the channel scales up, I'm really trying to commit to things I've wanted to do but previously told myself I don't have time or money to address. The first on that list is subtitles, which I'm going to do my best to provide for every video if I can. Sometimes they're uploaded a bit last minute/impromptu and I'll endeavour to get them up afterwards, but I'm now working with a company to get subtitles in place before publication if possible. To everyone who uses subtitles – sorry it took so long.
Link to Karina's 2019 paper about jugular flow on the International Space Station: https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamanetworkopen/fullarticle/2755307
Sign up for my free newsletter: https://medlife.substack.com/

entry.title: What Is The Future For Vaccines (and Trust)?

media:group.media:title: What Is The Future For Vaccines (and Trust)?
media:group.media:description:
I asked myself why I've only made 3 COVID-related videos this year, and the answers made me worried about the future.
This is my second video in a row that could be listened to as a podcast. So stop pestering me about still not having gotten around to starting that podcast. This is actually supreme efficiency pal. But seriously, I know it's kinda boring, it would make me happy if you just stuck it at x2 speed.
I haven't watched this back fully but I hope my message came across reasonably clearly. The last thing I would want to be doing is stoking the culture wars or misinformation which both surround COVID topics, especially vaccination. I'm just trying to say that...shit's complicated, ya get me?
References from the video:
ICNARC data (UK ICUs) data: https://www.icnarc.org/Our-Audit/Audits/Cmp/Reports UK briefing with data showing booster efficacy dropping off to 40% after 2.5 months: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1043807/technical-briefing-33.pdf Myocarditis risk vs COVID myocarditis risk: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41591-021-01630-0.pdf Preprint of subsequent breakdown: https://www.medrxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.12.23.21268276v1.full.pdf CDC guidance on children: https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/planning/children.html
-----------------
